title: Game mod on Steam breached to push password-stealing malware
description: Downfall, a fan expansion for the popular Slay the Spire indie strategy game, was breached on Christmas Day to push Epsilon information stealer malware using the Steam update system. [...]

title: Eagers Automotive halts trading in response to cyberattack
description: Eagers Automotive has announced it suffered a cyberattack and was forced to halt trading on the stock exchange as it evaluates the impact of the incident. [...]

title: EasyPark discloses data breach that may impact millions of users
description: Parking app developer EasyPark has published a notice on its website warning of a data breach it discovered on December 10, 2023, which impacts an unknown number of its millions of users. [...]

title: Microsoft disables MSIX protocol handler abused in malware attacks
description: Microsoft has again disabled the MSIX ms-appinstaller protocol handler after multiple financially motivated threat groups abused it to infect Windows users with malware. [...]

title: Kroll reveals FTX customer info exposed in August data breach
description: Risk and financial advisory company Kroll has released additional details regarding the August data breach, which exposed the personal information of FTX bankruptcy claimants. [...]

title: Russian military hackers target Ukraine with new MASEPIE malware
description: Ukraine's Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) is warning of a new phishing campaign that allowed Russia-linked hackers to deploy previously unseen malware on a network in under one hour. [...]

title: Apache OFBiz RCE flaw exploited to find vulnerable Confluence servers
description: A critical Apache OFBiz pre-authentication remote code execution vulnerability is being actively exploited using public proof of concept (PoC) exploits. [...]

title: Blockchain dev's wallet emptied in "job interview" using npm package
description: A blockchain developer shares his ordeal over the holidays when he was approached on LinkedIn by a "recruiter" for a web development job. The recruiter in question asked the developer to download npm packages from a GitHub repository, and hours later the developer discovered his MetaMask wallet had been emptied. [...]
